faqs.question: Ile kosztuje ta nieruchomość?

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca to dobre miejsce na zakup nieruchomości?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment destination. The region demonstrates 8% year-on-year price growth, attracts international buyers from across Europe, and offers properties 40% cheaper than Spanish island markets. The established expat community, reliable Mediterranean climate, and strong rental demand make it particularly attractive for holiday home investors.

faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens, UK residents, and international buyers all have equal rights to property ownership. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and should engage a Spanish lawyer to handle the purchase process, ensuring compliance with local regulations.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% additional costs including: transfer tax (6-8%), legal fees (€800-1,500), notary fees (€600-1,000), and property registration costs. Mortgage arrangements add surveyor and arrangement fees if financing. These costs are typically lower in inland properties like El Rafol D'almunia compared to coastal alternatives.

faqs.question: Ile wynosi podatek od nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Spanish property owners pay annual Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles (IBI) property tax, typically 0.4-0.7% of cadastral value annually. This property would incur approximately €600-900 annually depending on final valuation. Additionally, non-resident property owners pay non-resident income tax if renting the property, at approximately 19% of rental income.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages from major banks and specialist lenders. Typical financing covers 60-70% of purchase price with interest rates currently 3-4%. Many lenders work specifically with international buyers and understand documentation from UK and European sources. A Spanish mortgage advisor can identify suitable lenders and streamline the application process.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is significantly lower than UK equivalents. Property prices are 40% below island markets, while groceries, dining, and utilities cost approximately 30-40% less than UK levels. Healthcare and education are affordable, particularly if not using private services. A comfortable lifestyle for a couple costs €1,500-2,000 monthly, including mortgage payments.

faqs.question: Jaka jest pogoda na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 320+ days of sunshine annually. Summer temperatures average 28-30°C (June-September), while winter months (December-February) average 12-15°C—mild with occasional rainfall. This reliable climate supports year-round holiday home use and outdoor lifestyle, making it ideal for property investors seeking consistent vacation-season performance.

faqs.question: How far is Costa Blanca from UK?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is approximately 1,500 kilometers from London, requiring 2.5-3 hour direct flights from Alicante-Elche International Airport to major UK airports. Affordable flight options with budget carriers make regular UK visits feasible, supporting the holiday home lifestyle for British residents. The accessibility makes combining Mediterranean living with UK family connections practical.
